Reviews.Title: Fit almost perfect
Reviews.Author: mile d murzi
Reviews.Content: Needed this for my 97 240sx. Had to squeeze it in a little between the brackets but ended up fitting flush and nice

Reviews.Title: I recommend it
Reviews.Author: AAbloniz
Reviews.Content: The description of this product also the Amazon application shows that I can use this radio wiring harness kit in my vehicle(1995 Nissan Pathfinder 4x4 SE); however it didn’t work at all.  I bought a different one Metra 70-1763 with Amazon and this one works, it fits on the electrical wiring harness from the radio.  Amazon credits back my account that is why I am still shopping in Amazon; it is a reliable website company. Also if you have this kind of vehicle, it comes with the cd-player and the radio on top, you will need to buy Metra 98-7499 Turbo Pocket for Nissan Vehicle, if not you will have a whole top or bottom of your radio.  Also you need brackets to hold your radio with this Metra 98-7499.  You can use your original brackets from the original radio but you have to do some adjusts with your drills and dremel tool.

Reviews.Title: Good Fit
Reviews.Author: S. Fox "regular guy"
Reviews.Content: I installed this in the lower part of the radio and vent panel on a Nissan 300ZX.  I had previously installed a new radio on the upper part of the panel using a Metra install kit .This pocket fits perfectly against the panel and with the screw attachments provided.  It is well built and has plenty of room for sunglasses and other things.  A nice feature is the texture on the front lip of the pocket, which adds a touch of class to the plastic material.

Reviews.Title: Yup, fits
Reviews.Author: B. Peters
Reviews.Content: I replaced the factory double din audio unit in my 1993 Nissan Altima w/ a single din Pioneer CD player, and this pocket did just the trick to fill the rest of the space.  I used the existing cage so didn't need any kind of trim or install kit.

Reviews.Title: Ok.
Reviews.Author: Alexander Martinez
Reviews.Content: This pocket is very cheaply made. the front broke off, it doesnt stay in place. but its ok i guess.

Reviews.Title: Metra 98-7599 Turbo Pocket
Reviews.Author: Frazier L. Gaines
Reviews.Content: This item worked, short and simple. I took out my Din 2 radio, placed this between the brackets, installed it, set up my din 1 radio, and it was done! I wish I had bought this when I first tried it, it's the easiest and most obvious solution. Don't pass this up for another set, you can just use your factory brackets with this!
